class_labels.label: Good stroke
class_labels.description: Stroke which can be classified as correct rowing stroke, without big errors

class_labels.label: open back before legs
class_labels.description: During the drive the back/upper body is being opened too early.
class_labels.improvement: Wait until the legs have been pushed completely, then pull with upper body.

class_labels.label: mountain-rowing
class_labels.description: During the recovery the legs are moved forwards, although the arms are still bent and not prepared. This leads to a trajectory, where the hands will do a curve, to compensate for the missing space.
class_labels.improvement: Fully extend your arms first then bring upper body forward, then move with your legs forward.

class_labels.label: chest_push
class_labels.description: During the recovery the legs are pushing down, but the upper body stays forward and the hip angle between legs and upper body is getting sharper/smaller.
class_labels.improvement: Keep tension in the upper body and the hip angle constant during the leg drive.

class_labels.label: upper body not prepared
class_labels.description: During the upper body is being moved forward during the leg recovery. This can also include leaning forward at or shortly before the catch.
class_labels.improvement: After fully extending your arms, bring/move upper body completely forward, then only move with your legs forward. Keep the tension and your upper body stable during the leg recovery.
